title: Rambles in Europe in 1839. With sketches of prominent surgeons, physicians, medical schools, hospitals, literary personages, scenery, etc
author: Gibson, William
snippet: Of unquestionablenative talent and originality, joined to unflinching application, Dr. Hall has pushed his way to eminence by hisown individual merits and exertions—without any of theadventitious aids and trickeries which men of limitedcapacity and scanty acquirements so often resort to, successfully, to blind and bamboozle the public. Even beforehe graduated, and whilst a student in the Royal Infirmaryof Edinburgh, he delivered lectures on Diagnosis, andpublished reviews and essays in periodical journals. From that period to the present time, a space of nearlythirty years, he has been a most diligent and laboriouscultivator of almost every branch of medical science, ashis works, which speak for themselves, amply testify.
